page.title: 17Local History-cont'd
page.content: The surrounding countryside has not changed a great deal except that many of the field hedges have disappeared to make larger fields and of course there are many more machines used on the fields.One of the farms has become a farm shop it no longer works all its own land.Potatoes are still harvested in much the same way with eople coming from outside the area to help.The village forge has disappeared at is now a house which is up for sale it is one of the few thatched houses in area.What strikes her most as having changed is the housing, which has taken over much of the open space and quite a t of the farmland. She remembers the frantic building of the 1960's and 1970's when many fields and woodland was built over.The roads have changed little however ,Reculver was a much less busy place in her younger days.
